meanings.definition: Causing intense fear, shock, or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie was horrifying for the young children.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was so horrifying that many people refused to enter.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a clown riding a unicycle in space is horrifyingly funny.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering on the horizon were a horrifying omen of the storm to come.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the howling wind was truly horrifying, echoing through the empty streets.

meanings.sent1: The sudden appearance of a ghost was horrifying to the unsuspecting guests.
meanings.sent2: The deep, dark forest at night can be a truly horrifying place.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a squirrel wearing sunglasses is horrifyingly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room after the loud crash was more horrifying than the noise itself.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the towering, crumbling castle was utterly horrifying, like something from a nightmare.
